findings.title: Observations Regarding How Fast the Interest Indices Grow
findings.description: The borrow interest index may grow too large due to exponential growth when ∆𝑡 is larger than usual, potentially causing fixed-point arithmetic issues.

findings.title: Implementing State Updates
findings.description: Unnecessary state updates within a block can lead to interest manipulation attacks and waste resources. Updating state at most once per block by making it conditional on whether the state has already been updated in the current block can mitigate this.

findings.title: Using Pooled Transaction Fees to Simplify Fee Management
findings.description: The protocol can simplify fee management by using pooled transaction fees, allowing a single transaction to cover the fees of all or some transactions in the group.

findings.title: Increasing Fault-tolerance Using Multiple Different Oracles
findings.description: The lending contract relies on a single price oracle, which can be a single point of failure and potentially lead to DoS attacks or manipulation. Using multiple different price oracles and setting a rate tolerance level can mitigate this risk.

findings.title: Liquidity-providing program
findings.description: The liquidity-providing program does not allow providers to borrow against their deposits because they are not issued 'ff_tokens' that can be locked for collateral.

findings.title: Implementing Flash Loans
findings.description: Flash loans require proper support from the underlying blockchain platform and cooperation with external third parties, but currently, it is not supported by Algorand blockchain and lacks reliable oracles and coordination with other service providers.

findings.title: Whitelisting of Markets
findings.description: The creation of lending pools should be permissioned to ensure predictability and security. Whitelisting pools requires considering asset types and trusted addresses.
